intro: Anisotome, commonly known as the grass of parnassus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, often growing in alpine meadows. Anisotome species are typically perennial and have a fibrous root system that helps them survive in harsh environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
